definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.chinese: 他說，“我沒做飯，我剛放了個屁。”

sentences.english: She also practices boxing, planting vegetables on her roof garden, and cooks all by herself.
sentences.chinese: 她還練習拳擊，在屋頂花園種蔬菜，自己做飯。

sentences.english: His wife never cooks for him.
She says people caught in the earthquake are unable to cook and require ready-to-eat foods.
sentences.chinese: 她還說遭受地震的人們不能做飯，需要的是方便食物。

sentences.english: There was even cherry pie, for dessert.
sentences.chinese: 還有櫻桃派做飯後的甜點。

sentences.english: After a difficult day at the office, Greta came home and began cooking dinner.
sentences.chinese: 在辦公室過完忙碌的一天，格里塔回到家開始做飯。

sentences.english: She helped clean and cook to pay for her stay.
sentences.chinese: 她靠幫忙打掃和做飯來支付她的留宿。

sentences.english: In addition to that, I enjoy cooking.
sentences.chinese: 除此之外，我也喜歡做飯。

sentences.english: I cook sometimes,but not so often.
sentences.chinese: 我有時候會做飯，但不經常。

sentences.english: I cooked outside -- rain or shine -- on a rocket stove I made.
sentences.chinese: 無論晴雨天，我都用自制的火箭爐在戶外做飯。

sentences.english: We need a baby-sitter and a cook. Can you do it?
sentences.chinese: 我們需要一個帶孩子兼做飯的。你做得來嗎？

sentences.english: Cooking is an essential ritual for balanced living.
sentences.chinese: 做飯是平衡生活的重要環節。

sentences.english: Women are responsible for cooking, raising children, and taking care of housework.
sentences.chinese: 婦女負責做飯，撫養孩子，家務勞動。

sentences.english: The house had a large kitchen to cook in.
sentences.chinese: 這房子有個燒菜做飯的大廚房。

sentences.english: Do it so you don’t have to do it before each recipe.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你就不必每次做飯前洗菜了。

definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
what are you doing?/what's he up to?
